content: Listen to this article (0 minutes)was created from a revision of this article dated 6 June 2012 (2012-06-06), and does not reflect subsequent edits.(Audio help · More spoken articles) **Singapore men's national softball team** is the national team for [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). In the 1992 [World Championships](/wiki/ISF_Men%27s_World_Championship), the eighth time the event was competed for, held in [Manila](/wiki/Manila). Australia beat Singapore 14–0 in one game in the first round robin round. In the [2014 Asian Men's Softball Championship](/wiki/2014_Asian_Men%27s_Softball_Championship), Singapore came in forth. In the [2015 Southeast Asian Games](/wiki/2015_Southeast_Asian_Games), Singapore came in third. In the [2018 Asian Men's Softball Championship](/wiki/2018_Asian_Men%27s_Softball_Championship), Singapore won Indonesia to clinched the third position. The victory increased the team ranking from 21st to top 16 which qualified the team for 2019 [World Baseball Softball Confederation](/wiki/World_Baseball_Softball_Confederation)'s [Men's Softball World Championship](/wiki/Men%27s_Softball_World_Championship), the first time they qualified for the Championships. This article about sports in Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about a softball team is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Singapore men's national softball team
